1:
We have heard with our ears, God,\q our fathers have told us
\q what work you did in their days,
\q in the days of old.
\q
2:
You drove out the nations with your hand,\q but you planted our people;
\q you afflicted the peoples,
\q but you spread our people out in the land.


\q
3:
For they did not obtain the land for their possession by their own sword,\q neither did their own arm save them;
\q but your right hand, your arm, and the light of your face,
\q because you were favorable to them.
\q
4:
God, You are my King;\q command victory for Jacob.


\q
5:
Through you we will push down our adversaries;\q through your name we will tread them under, those who rise up against us.
\q
6:
For I will not trust in my bow,\q neither will my sword save me.


\q
7:
But you have saved us from our adversaries,\q and have put to shame those who hate us.
\q
8:
In God we have made our boast all the day long,\q and we will give thanks to your name forever.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
9:
But now you have thrown us off and brought us dishonor,\q and you do not go out with our armies.
\q
10:
You make us turn back from the adversary;\q and those who hate us take spoil for themselves.
\q
11:
You have made us like sheep destined for food\q and have scattered us among the nations.


\q
12:
You sell your people for nothing;\q you have not increased your wealth by doing so.
\q
13:
You make us a rebuke to our neighbors,\q scoffed and mocked by those around us.
\q
14:
You make us an insult among the nations,\q a shaking of the head among the peoples.


\q
15:
All the day long my dishonor is before me,\q and the shame of my face has covered me
\q
16:
because of the voice of him who rebukes and insults,\q because of the enemy and the avenger.
\q
17:
All this has come on us; yet we have not forgotten you\q or dealt falsely with your covenant.


\q
18:
Our heart has not turned back;\q our steps have not gone from your way.
\q
19:
Yet you have severely broken us in the place of jackals\q and covered us with the shadow of death.
\q
20:
If we have forgotten the name of our God\q or spread out our hands to a strange god,
\q
21:
would not God search this out?\q For he knows the secrets of the heart.
\q
22:
Indeed, for your sake we are being killed all day long;\q we are considered to be sheep for the slaughter.


\q
23:
Awake, why do you sleep, Lord?\q Arise, do not throw us off permanently.
\q
24:
Why do you hide your face\q and forget our affliction and our oppression?


\q
25:
For we have melted away into the dust;\q our bodies cling to the earth.
\q
26: Rise up for our help\q and redeem us for the sake of your covenant faithfulness.
